metadata.prompt_optimization: Optimized V2.0 November 7, 2025 - Added CAN-25, renumbered 1-25, enhanced flagging guidance

compositions.prompt_text: Show me my pending invitations and which ones I should prioritize based on my priorities for this week: customer meetings and product strategy.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent: show pending invitations and prioritize based on weekly priorities (customer meetings and product strategy). Identify constraints: timeframe = this week, priorities = customer meetings and product strategy.
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and extract actionable parameters.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events and invitations for the current week from the user's calendar.
execution_plan.note: Required to get the raw set of events to filter pending invitations.

execution_plan.description: Extract RSVP status and other metadata from retrieved events to identify which invitations are still pending.
execution_plan.note: Enables filtering for pending invitations and provides details for prioritization.

execution_plan.description: Classify each pending invitation by meeting type (e.g., customer meeting, product strategy, internal sync).
execution_plan.note: Needed to identify which meetings match the user's stated priorities.

execution_plan.description: Assess the importance of each pending invitation relative to the user's priorities (customer meetings and product strategy).
execution_plan.note: Ranks pending invitations based on strategic value and user-defined priorities.

parallelization_opportunities: step 4 and step 5 can run in parallel after metadata extraction
orchestration.error_handling: If classification or importance assessment fails, return pending invitations without prioritization; retry retrieval on transient errors.

compositions.prompt_text: I have some important meetings coming up. Help me track all my important meetings this week and flag any that require focus time to prepare for them.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent: identify that the user wants to track important meetings this week and flag those requiring preparation time.
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and extract constraints like timeframe (this week), importance, and prep time requirement.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events for the current week to identify which meetings are scheduled.
execution_plan.note: Needed to get the raw set of meetings for this week.

execution_plan.description: Extract metadata from each meeting such as attendees, RSVP status, attachments, and notes to support preparation time analysis and flagging.
execution_plan.note: Provides details required for prep time estimation and importance assessment.

execution_plan.description: Classify each meeting by type (e.g., 1:1, team sync, client meeting) to help contextualize importance and preparation needs.
execution_plan.note: Supports understanding of meeting context for importance and prep time.

execution_plan.description: Assess the strategic importance of each meeting to identify which ones are 'important' as per the user request.
execution_plan.note: Determines which meetings qualify as important for tracking.

execution_plan.description: Estimate preparation time required for each meeting based on complexity, attachments, and agenda details.
execution_plan.note: Identifies which meetings require focus time to prepare.

execution_plan.description: Flag meetings that require preparation time so the user can easily identify them.
execution_plan.note: Adds visual indicators or annotations to meetings needing prep time.

parallelization_opportunities: step 4 and step 5 can run in parallel after step 3
orchestration.error_handling: If metadata extraction fails, fallback to basic event info; if prep time analysis fails, still return important meetings without flags.

compositions.prompt_text: Help me understand where I am spending my time across different types of meetings and suggest ways I might reclaim time for my top priorities.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent: analyze time allocation across meeting types and suggest ways to reclaim time for top priorities.
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and identify goals: breakdown by meeting type and optimization suggestions.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events for the relevant timeframe (e.g., past month or user-specified period) to analyze time distribution.
Extract metadata from retrieved events such as attendees, duration, and meeting details to support classification and analysis.
execution_plan.note: Provides foundational data for classification and time aggregation.

execution_plan.description: Classify each meeting into types (e.g., 1:1, team sync, customer) to enable breakdown of time spent by category.
Assess the strategic importance and priority of each meeting to identify which meetings align with top priorities and which do not.
Aggregate total time spent across different meeting types and compute statistics to show patterns and identify time sinks.
Generate visual representations (charts, graphs) of time spent by meeting type and importance to help the user understand patterns.
Match current meeting patterns against the user's stated top priorities to identify misalignments and opportunities to reclaim time.
Generate personalized recommendations for reclaiming time, such as reducing low-priority meetings or consolidating similar sessions.

parallelization_opportunities: Steps 4 and 5 could partially overlap after metadata extraction, but typically run sequentially for dependency clarity.
orchestration.error_handling: If visualization fails, still return textual breakdown and recommendations; retry retrieval and classification on transient errors.

compositions.prompt_text: Set up a weekly 30-minute 1:1 with {name}. I'd prefer afternoons and want to avoid Fridays. Automatically reschedule on declines or conflicts.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (schedule recurring meeting), constraints (weekly, 30 minutes, afternoons, avoid Fridays), attendee ({name}), and special instructions (auto-reschedule on declines/conflicts).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step - interpret natural language into structured data

execution_plan.description: Resolve the provided attendee name to a directory entry or email address to ensure accurate invitation.
execution_plan.note: Needed to correctly identify and invite the specified person

execution_plan.description: Retrieve the user's calendar events for the relevant timeframe to check availability and avoid conflicts.
execution_plan.note: Required to find open slots and avoid conflicts

execution_plan.description: Check free/busy status for both the user and the resolved attendee to find common available slots that meet constraints (afternoons, avoid Fridays).
execution_plan.note: Ensures the meeting is scheduled at a mutually available time

execution_plan.description: Apply scheduling constraints (weekly recurrence, 30-minute duration, afternoons, avoid Fridays) to select the optimal time slot from available options.
execution_plan.note: Optimizes scheduling based on user preferences and constraints

execution_plan.description: Generate an RRULE for a weekly recurring meeting based on the selected slot and constraints.
execution_plan.note: Creates the recurrence pattern for the 1:1 meeting

execution_plan.description: Enable automatic rescheduling logic to handle declines or conflicts by finding alternative slots that meet the original constraints.
execution_plan.note: Implements the user's request for auto-rescheduling on declines or conflicts

parallelization_opportunities: Steps 3 and 5 cannot run in parallel due to dependency, but attendee resolution (step 2) could theoretically run in parallel with calendar retrieval (step 3) after NLU.
orchestration.error_handling: If attendee resolution fails, prompt user for clarification. If availability check fails, suggest alternative constraints. Retry rescheduling logic on transient errors.

compositions.prompt_text: I need to clear my schedule for Thursday afternoon to focus on our product review. Help me reschedule or decline those meetings so I have dedicated time to prepare.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (clear Thursday afternoon), constraints (timeframe: Thursday afternoon), and actions (reschedule or decline meetings, create prep time).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step - interpret natural language to structured form.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events scheduled for Thursday afternoon to identify which meetings need to be rescheduled or declined.
Extract metadata for the retrieved events, including attendees, RSVP status, and logistics, to determine which meetings can be moved or declined.
execution_plan.note: Needed to understand meeting details before rescheduling or declining.

execution_plan.description: Classify each meeting by type (e.g., 1:1, team sync, customer) to help decide which meetings are easier to reschedule or decline.
Assess the strategic importance and urgency of each meeting to prioritize which ones to reschedule versus decline.
execution_plan.note: Runs in parallel with CAN-02 after metadata extraction.

execution_plan.description: Estimate the preparation time needed for the product review and ensure enough focus time is blocked after clearing the schedule.
Formulate scheduling constraints to free Thursday afternoon and maintain critical meetings elsewhere in the calendar.
Automatically reschedule lower-priority meetings to alternative time slots or mark them for decline based on the constraint satisfaction output.
execution_plan.note: Executes after constraints are solved.

execution_plan.description: Update RSVP statuses for declined meetings and send notifications to attendees about rescheduled times.

parallelization_opportunities: step 4 and step 5 can run in parallel after step 3
orchestration.error_handling: If automatic rescheduling fails, fallback to manual suggestion; retry RSVP updates on failure; log and notify user for any unsatisfied constraints.

compositions.prompt_text: Find a time in the next two weeks for a 1 hour meeting with Chris, Sangya, and Kat. We need to work around Kat's schedule since she's traveling. Make the meeting in person and add a room.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract constraints: 1-hour meeting, next two weeks, attendees (Chris, Sangya, Kat), in-person requirement, add a room, and prioritize Kat's availability due to travel.
execution_plan.note: Universal first step - extract all scheduling constraints and intent

execution_plan.description: Resolve Chris, Sangya, and Kat to their directory entries and calendars, ensuring correct identity mapping.
execution_plan.note: Needed to access their availability and calendars

execution_plan.description: Retrieve calendar events for the next two weeks for the user and all resolved attendees.
execution_plan.note: Required to check availability and constraints

execution_plan.description: Check free/busy status across all attendees' calendars to find common available slots for 1 hour, considering Kat's travel schedule.
execution_plan.note: Core step to identify possible meeting times

execution_plan.description: Apply constraints such as in-person requirement, Kat's travel limitations, and duration to select the optimal time slot.
execution_plan.note: Ensures all user-specified conditions are satisfied

execution_plan.description: Book an appropriate meeting room for the selected time slot to fulfill the in-person requirement.
execution_plan.note: Handles the 'add a room' requirement

parallelization_opportunities: None due to strong dependencies between steps
orchestration.error_handling: If room booking fails, suggest alternative rooms or times; if attendee resolution fails, prompt user for clarification

compositions.prompt_text: Help me set the agenda to review the progress of Project Alpha. I want to get confirmation we are on track and discuss any blocking issues or risks.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (set agenda), key entities (Project Alpha), and objectives (review progress, confirm on track, discuss blocking issues or risks).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and derive constraints.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve upcoming meetings related to Project Alpha to identify the correct meeting for agenda setting.
Extract metadata from the identified Project Alpha meeting such as attendees, notes, and any existing agenda or attachments.
execution_plan.note: Needed to understand meeting details before generating agenda.

execution_plan.description: Generate a structured agenda for the Project Alpha meeting including topics: progress review, confirmation of being on track, and discussion of blocking issues or risks.
execution_plan.note: Directly addresses the user's request to set the agenda.

execution_plan.description: Analyze historical meeting notes and context to anticipate potential risks or blockers to include in the agenda discussion.
execution_plan.note: Supports the user's goal to discuss blocking issues or risks.

parallelization_opportunities: Step 4 and Step 5 could partially run in parallel after metadata extraction
orchestration.error_handling: If metadata extraction fails, fallback to generating a generic agenda template; if risk anticipation fails, proceed with agenda without risk section.

compositions.prompt_text: I have a meeting with senior leadership tomorrow. Find the most recent meeting with them and summarize the topics into 3 discussion points. Generate any objections or concerns that might come up and give me effective responses.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent: identify that the user wants to find the most recent meeting with senior leadership, summarize topics into 3 discussion points, and generate objections with responses.
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and extract constraints like 'senior leadership', 'most recent meeting', 'summarize topics', 'generate objections and responses'.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all recent calendar events, focusing on meetings involving senior leadership, including tomorrow's meeting and past meetings.
execution_plan.note: Needed to access historical and upcoming meetings to find the most recent one with senior leadership.

execution_plan.description: Extract metadata from retrieved events such as attendees, meeting titles, descriptions, and notes to identify senior leadership meetings and their topics.
execution_plan.note: Required to confirm which meetings include senior leadership and to access topics for summarization.

execution_plan.description: Resolve 'senior leadership' to actual attendee names and match them against meeting participants to filter relevant meetings.
execution_plan.note: Ensures accurate identification of meetings with senior leadership.

execution_plan.description: Generate a concise summary of the most recent senior leadership meeting, condensing topics into 3 clear discussion points.
execution_plan.note: Fulfills the requirement to summarize topics into 3 discussion points.

execution_plan.description: Analyze the context of the upcoming senior leadership meeting and past discussions to anticipate potential objections or concerns.
execution_plan.note: Addresses the user's request to generate possible objections or concerns.

execution_plan.description: Generate effective responses to each anticipated objection, formatted for easy reference during the meeting.
execution_plan.note: Completes the requirement by providing actionable responses to anticipated objections.

parallelization_opportunities: Steps 6 and 7 could partially overlap after objections are generated, but generally sequential for clarity.
orchestration.error_handling: If attendee resolution fails, fallback to keyword matching for 'senior leadership'; if summarization fails, provide raw meeting notes.

compositions.prompt_text: Prepare me for my meeting with our customer Beta tomorrow. Include a background on their company, create a dossier of who will attend and include their interests so I can have better conversations.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent: prepare for a customer meeting with Beta tomorrow, gather company background, attendee dossier with interests.
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and identify tasks like research, attendee info, and meeting details.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve calendar events for tomorrow to locate the meeting with customer Beta.
execution_plan.note: Needed to find the specific meeting and its details.

execution_plan.description: Extract metadata for the Beta meeting: attendees, RSVP status, meeting link, notes, and any attached documents.
execution_plan.note: Provides attendee list and other details required for dossier creation.

execution_plan.description: Resolve attendee names from the Beta meeting to directory entries and enrich with known profiles.
execution_plan.note: Enables building a detailed dossier of attendees.

execution_plan.description: Gather background information on Beta (the customer company) and identify attendee interests from past interactions or public data.
execution_plan.note: Fulfills the request for company background and attendee interests.

execution_plan.description: Generate a structured briefing dossier combining company background and attendee profiles with interests.
execution_plan.note: Creates the final deliverable for the user to prepare for the meeting.

parallelization_opportunities: Steps 4 and 5 could partially overlap after metadata extraction
orchestration.error_handling: If research fails, provide partial dossier with available attendee and meeting details; retry external data fetch with backoff.
